Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can draw a single habitat, like a garden or playground, with basic features such as the ground and a few objects present (e.g., a tree or a bush).
The student can include simplistic representations of one or two living things, like a vague shape of an animal or a plant, without details.
CANNOT: The student is unable to accurately depict multiple habitats or show differences between them (student may only draw one type of setting).
The student cannot illustrate a variety of living things specific to those habitats (animals or plants might be drawn generically without detail).
The student does not show or misrepresents the relationships between living things and their environment (e.g., placing a fish on a tree or animals that don't belong in the depicted habitat).
The student does not identify patterns of biodiversity or compare types of living things between habitats (no diversity shown, misunderstanding what different habitats are).
